intro: Acer heptalobum, commonly known as the seven-lobed maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with seven distinct lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds known as samaras. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers moist, well-drained soils. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
